title: Amid heavy fighting, Gaza hospitals are collapsing
summary: The facilities are surrounded by the Israeli army, which is hunting down Hamas underground installations. Gazans who had sought refuge there and some of the staff are fleeing the fighting toward the south of the enclave.

title: Displaced Gazans lack everything in overcrowded UNRWA shelters
summary: Around 50 UN agency buildings have been hit by Israeli bombardments in Gaza and around 66 people were killed.

title: Protesters demonstrate against world leaders, Israel-Hamas war as APEC summit is held in San Francisco
summary: Protests are expected throughout this week's Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation leaders' conference, which could draw more than 20,000 attendees. Headlining the summit is a highly anticipated meeting between Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping.

title: Over 180,000 rally against anti-Semitism across France
summary: President Macron, who did not attend the demonstrations, condemned on Sunday the 'unbearable resurgence of unbridled anti-Semitism' in the country.

title: Canada criticized for its weak policy against global warming
summary: The world's fourth-largest producer of fossil fuels, Canada has been slow to implement measures to cap emissions from its oil and gas industries.

title: Tennis: Novak Djokovic secures year-end No. 1 spot
summary: Djokovic needed only one match win at the ATP Finals to be sure of keeping the top spot and the 24-time Grand Slam champion did it in his opener, beating Holger Rune 7-6 (4), 6-7 (1), 6-3 on Sunday.

title: Hundreds of dual nationals leave war-torn Gaza as evacuations through Egypt resume
summary: Since November 1, dozens of wounded Palestinians have also been evacuated to Egyptian hospitals through the Rafah border crossing.

title: Pedro Sánchez wins support of Catalan separatists with concessions that inflame Spain
summary: To retain his position, the Socialist PM has signed an agreement with Junts party toward a controversial amnesty law. The People's Party (right-wing) has called for demonstrations on Sunday.

title: In Senegal, wigs are 'locks of gold,' coveted by thieves
summary: Thefts of hairpieces, which can be worth hundreds of euros, are on the rise in Dakar.

title: Five waterside restaurants in Paris and the Ile-de-France region
summary: On the banks of the Marne or the Canal de l'Ourcq, on a terrace with a view or in the shade of a large oak tree, you'll find reimagined classics and chef's surprises.

title: Gaza: Arab and Muslim countries fail to come up with joint post-war initiative
summary: The leaders who took part in Saturday's extraordinary joint summit of the Arab League and the Organization of the Islamic Conference (OIC) did issue a final declaration condemning Israel's war in Gaza.

title: At 17, Ruth Orkin set out on her bike to photograph America
summary: In 1939, traveled the United States, refining her art from Los Angeles to New York. Some 40 photographs taken on this journey are on display at the Henri Cartier-Bresson Foundation in Paris.

title: Inside the kitchens of migrant women in Tunisia
summary: Léna, Nathalie, Rebecca and Marcelle fight every day to create new prospects for themselves, despite the hardships, the Covid crisis, inflation and waves of racist violence. They are caught between the desire to stay in Tunis and homesickness.

title: Myanmar junta attempts to attract tourists in a quest to bring in foreign currency
summary: Tourist operators in France are readily promoting a country under military dictatorship rule since the coup d'état of February 1, 2021.

title: Are abortion rights under threat in France?
summary: French President Emmanuel Macron has said he wants to enshrine women's 'freedom' to have an abortion in the French constitution by 2024.

title: The first whole-eye transplant
summary: An American team has announced a partial double transplant of a face and one eye. Five months on, the surgery has been a success, even if the patient's vision has not been restored.

title: Biodiversity: EU to adopt nature restoration law
summary: Member states and the European Parliament agreed on Thursday to a bill that calls for the restoration of 30% of damaged ecosystems by 2030. According to EU data, over 80% of natural habitats are in poor condition.

title: The race to repatriate Bogdan Ermokhin, an orphan from Mariupol deported to Russia
summary: The young Ukrainian will turn 18 on November 19. His cousin and his lawyer are fighting for his return, fearing that when he comes of age he will be drafted against his will into the Russian army.

title: US: Republican presidential candidate Tim Scott drops out of the 2024 race
summary: The announcement comes about two months before the start of voting in Iowa's leadoff caucuses.

title: Algeria appoints a new prime minister to prepare for President Tebboune's second term
summary: Nadir Larbaoui, 74, has been appointed, 13 months ahead of the next presidential election.

title: Living in low-income housing in upmarket Paris: 'Once you're here, everything changes'
summary: Some of the capital's public housing tenants live in neighborhoods with unmet social diversity quotas and where local residents are sometimes reluctant to welcome newcomers.

title: Major Australian ports reopen three days after cyberattack
summary: Major ports handling 40 percent of Australia's freight trade have resumed operations on Monday.

title: The day after in Gaza: 'Marwan Barghouti's popularity is probably the only barrier against Hamas'
summary: The Palestinian Authority is too discredited to be in charge of a post-conflict political process in Gaza, unlike former Secretary-General of Fatah Marwan Barghouti, currently detained in Israel.

title: Barcelona's Sagrada Familia inaugurates four new towers
summary: The basilica designed by Antoni Gaudí has been 141 years in the making, but it has come one step closer to completion with the blessing of the four Towers of the Evangelists.

title: In Lebanon, Palestinians show solidarity with Hamas
summary: Supporters of the Islamist organisation want Arab countries to be more involved in support of Gaza.
